Mr. J wrote:

>
> Thanks to everyone helping out.  I checked out HEAD via sourceforge
> cvs and I added two more class for scope as suggested.  I am also
> using Eclipse, so I did the test run on Eclipse and it works great.

Good.

>
> One thought on DomainScope, if my seed url is dept1.siteA.com,
> DomainScope won't take dept2.siteA.com as in scope, but it does if my
> seed url is www.siteA.com becasuse we strip www[0-9] from the url.  I
> still couldn't decide whether it is what I want or not, I am sure it
> is not hard to do that change.  I just thought it is worth mentioning.

Yeah. www gets treated differently from other subdomains being sorta 
equated to the domain that results from stripping of www.

>
> I saw the Lowercase URL rule, it seems simple enough to modify.  I'll
> sure post on the mailing list if I ever changed it. 

Grand.

>
> Okie, question move to next step.  How do I deploy my changes ?  I
> tried to run maven build as in the developer's manual.  Build run but
> it failed on several Test.  And there are no files in
> target/distribution folder I am assuming because of test failed ? Oh,
> I am running this on windows machine because of my IDE, my production
> run will be on Linux though.  I try to build the jar file from the
> class folder and it runs but several errors in web browser since my
> war file is from 1.2
>
Checkout http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#testsfail. Build on the 
production machine if you can (Its hard to support you on windows -- I 
don't have one to hand).

> One issue I notice while I am running under Eclipse, the link to
> /jobs/pending.jsp and completed.jsp are broken, I am getting 404.  I
> am not sure is it because I am under development run under eclipse ?
>
Fixed yesterday (Thanks for pointing it out).
Yours,
St.Ack

>
> Okie, it is getting a bit long.  Thanks for your time.
>
> Laters,
> Jay
>
> > Let me add qualification to the above.  I suggested using HEAD because
> > its stablizing as we ready for 1.4 release, limited testng show no
> > glaring issues, and we ourselves have been using recent versions of
> > HEAD doing large crawls (HEAD also has loads of fixes, new features,
> > and lasts much longer before OOME'ing).  That said, for 'production
> > purposes', you should always use released versions of Heritrix (For
> > what you're trying to do, there is no change in canonicalization rules
> > API so it should be easy bringing forward 1.2 rules).
> >
> > Yours,
> > St.Ack
>
